description: In true sense “Better late than never“, idiom perfect fit for Reliance, Adani , TATA the Indian conglomerates. In latest move Reliance Industries has set a target of achieving 100GW of Renewable Energy by 2030. Likewise TATA has announced achieving clean energy portfolio of 60GW by 2030. The leader of all Adani Group has already achieved 25GW of Renewable Energy capacities four year ahead of the schedule.
title: Reliance vs TATA vs Adani: India’s Renewable Behemoth

description: Center is planning 4000 MWh of battery storage tenders in coming days. Industry expert believes that excess renewable energy must be store in utility scale energy storage plant to offload store energy at night time thus balancing grid parity.  The IEA said that India could have 140 GW to 200 GW of battery storage capacity by 2040.
title: After Utility scale Solar – Now it’s time for Utility scale Storage
New Topcon solar cell achieve 25.19% Efficiency- Longi Solar
description: Longi Solar has achieved two more efficiency records. It claimed to have reached a power conversion efficiency of 25.02% for a p-type monocrystalline bifacial TOPCon solar cell and explained it is the first time that a cell based on this technology surpasses the 25% barrier.

title: How Subsidies Electrical Vehicles to rescue your ballooned fuel budget?
description: Petrol, diesel prices have touched three digits and household fuel budget is rising day by day with no respite for next coming years.  The freight charges have increased substantially for many months.  But there is set of option available to cool my budget. EV is the best option at lease to break my rising fuel cost. More over many states are providing subsidies on EV purchase to cut a purchase cost up to 50,000 on two wheelers and 1.5 Lakh on four wheelers. With technology advancing day by day EV cost will come down with government assistance.

title: 100GW Renewable Energy Target by 2030 – Reliance Industries
description: Reliance Industries will create or enable capacity to generate at least 100 gig watts of electricity by 2030 from renewable sources, which can be converted into carbon-free green hydrogen, its chairman Mukesh Ambani said Friday as he outlined a ‘1-1-1 vision’ to bring down the cost of hydrogen to under $1 for one kg in one decade. The focus on generating electricity from renewable sources of energy such as solar and wind will help cut carbon emissions in the world’s third-largest greenhouse gas emitter. The same electricity, when converted into green hydrogen, can replace petrol and diesel in automobiles and other fuels in the industry, helping cut down on the use of fossil fuels, carbon emissions and reduce import dependence.

Under PLI scheme for High-efficiency modules will spur investment of over 14000 Crore and build a manufacturing capacity of more than 10GW. Presently Waare Energy, First Solar, Vikram Solar, Rayzon Solar, Premier solar and others to add GW capacity plant which will be operational by mid of 2022.
title: Decoding PLI scheme in solar sector

description: Food ordering and delivery platform Swiggy on Thursday said it has signed an agreement with Reliance BP Mobility Ltd (RBML) to build an EV ecosystem and battery-swapping stations for its delivery partners across the country. RBML will set up Jio-bp battery swapping stations at various locations assisted by Swiggy and provide all required technical assistance and training to Swiggy delivery partners.
title: Swiggy –Reliance BP Mobility Limited sign contract for EV ecosystem

description: Lucas TVS, an automotive components manufacturer, will set up a semisolid lithium-ion cell manufacturing facility in the Chennai under a technology licensing agreement with U.S. startup 24M. The first phase of the planned 10 GWh fab will start production in the second half of 2023. Massachusetts-based 24M describes its Semi Solid manufacturing process as a simple, space-efficient, low-cost, modular approach to lithium-ion battery manufacturing. The process, designed around the use of standard lithium-ion supply chain materials, is expected to produce greater than 50% capex savings versus conventional manufacturing lines.
title: 10 GWh lithium-ion battery fab: Lucas TVS
EV- Challenges and Opportunity
description: EV truly changing the world into a better place and saving our planet from extinction. EV Can save India’s substantial crude import bill of billions of dollars. The Adoption of BEV and PHEV curve is in northern direction as companies across the globe cutting their Carbon emission and going for EV roll out. But challenges remain in terms of limited charging station and battery life cycle. Import of lithium-ion batteries is also a cause of concern because of dependency on countries that have rich resources.

India’s power demand surge to all time high 200 GW in July 2021. India’s non peak demand could increase substantially as sale of Electrical vehicles increase many folds. That means vehicle charging demand to go up at night time. For load-generation balancing, construction of energy storage projects that can regulate the frequency of the grid in a timely fashion should be prioritized. With advance of latest batteries technology we are tackling the biggest barrier to deep decarbonization making renewable energy available when and where it’s needed, even during multiple days of extreme weather or rid outages. Visibly storage of access renewable energy in to few hundred MW size is already under execution as per initial plan.
title: GW size storage to balance peak energy demand by EV

description: Net Meter Vs Gross Meter Vs Zero Export Meter In first net metering system introduced with much fanfare where difference of energy unit Import and export accounting is consider for billing.     In Gross metering monetary value of Energy import and export units will taken separately in account. Difference of both will be net payable to Discom by consumer.   The world is moving toward zero export metering where consumer directly use generated solar power and ensure that no export to the grid.
title: Net Meter vs Gross Meter vs Zero Export Meter
Catch me if you can- Tesla to Gujarat, TN and Maharashtra on investment
description: In a bid to woo Elon Musk's Tesla, the Gujarat government has offered 1,000 acres of land free of cost to set up its manufacturing unit in the western state. The Maharashtra government also in talks with the American electric vehicle giant Tesla to invite them to invest in the state, a state minister said in a tweet. Several other states lays out red carpet for Tesla as car maker set to enter Indian market.

title: Your Full EV Battery can charge in 10 Minutes:
description: StoreDot, which specializes in extreme fast charging battery technology for electric vehicles, has revealed its ‘ground-breaking’ silicon-dominant technology applied in extreme fast charging (XFC) cylindrical cells. In a world-first, the company demonstrated the prototype 4680 form factor that is fully charged in just 10 minutes.

A race is on between Delhi and Leh to become the country’s first cities running public transport system with Green Hydrogen. The Leh administration, on the other hand, now has an agreement with NTPC REL for introducing such buses. The Hydrogen buses would be a Zero emission vehicles as  hydrogen produced by Renewable Energy sources terms as a Green Coding.
title: After Diesel & Electric Bus now ride on Hydrogen power Buses
Green Hydrogen Production- Who’s inn
description: In latest JSW future Energy has partner with Australian Fortescue Future Industries Pty, TATA, and Reliance Industry among others are partnering with Hydrogen technology leaders to tap opportunities in Green Hydrogen.

title: Now is time to add Next EV in your Fleet
description: Slew of automotive leaders are pouring billions of dollars new investment in EV roll out. BMW, KIA, MG, GM, Hyundai, JLR all are in race to launch more than 50 new EV models in next 12 Months. It seems competition remains hot and ultimately consumer gets the choice and price advantages. So plan your next vehicle all electric instead of diesel because that gives you a green number plate to rejoice.

We must continue to pursue collaboration opportunities with leaders across the industry to reap EV benefits. A shift this massive requires the entire mobility and energy ecosystem to work together toward a single goal – a zero-emissions, all-electric future.  Our approach is centered on working closely with a network of leaders in the charging, ridesharing, infrastructure, battery and vehicle development fields. Uniting with experts and exploring solutions across every facet of the EV ecosystem should allow us to make EVs affordable to own and unlock the best benefits to improve the EV driving experience, charging infrastructure and EV rideshare access. - General Motors
title: Building EV Ecosystem for Net Zero

description: India has the potential to meet not just the country’s but also the global demand for green hydrogen. Union Minister of state for earth sciences and Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh.  Explaining India’s ‘aspirational’ goal of Hydrogen 2-1-2, the minister said, “2 Means green hydrogen that nation cost for less than $2 per KG; 1 means hydrogen storage plus distribution plus refueling that cost less than #1 per kg and the last 2 is for replacement of incumbent end-us technology with green hydrogen technology of less than 2 millions.”
title: Green Hydrogen 2-1-2 approach:

description: One of the answers to climate change is “Green hydrogen”. Companies around the world working overnight to become hydrogen superpower. At very low cost, say $1.5 per kg or even lower starts the hydrogen Age. Net zero emission and de-carbonization of all the processes can possible even early after entry of these new candidate.
title: Green Hydrogen – “True Game Changer”
Unit Economics after imposing 40% BCD on solar and 25% on Cell from 1st April 2022
description: Under Atmanirbhar Bharat initiative 40% BCD on solar and 25% on Solar cell will applicable with effect from 1st April 2022. The feel is already visible in under sign tenders. Latest discovered tariff are 2.43/unit to 2.62/unit, much higher than 1.99/ unit, the lowest discovered in GUVNL bid. Industry expert anticipate that tariff will rise further by 25-40 paisa/unit on account of rice of overall cost of project.

title: No Hybrid, drive fully electric Vehicle soon
description: The main difference between a hybrid car and an electric car is that the hybrid combines an internal combustion engine and electric motor(s) to send power to its wheels. However, the electric car draws power from a single source of the electric motor(s) to propel the vehicle.  While hybrid cars offer better fuel efficiency or longer distances/ranges, electric vehicles are still yet to reach that potential. That said, electric vehicles pollute lower emissions compared to hybrid cars who are dependent on an internal combustion engine. With researchers are advancing towards more power full batteries technology that drive more than 1000 KM in single charge and charge 0 to 80 percent in 30 Minutes, automobiles sector is gaining momentum building to roll out their next EV fleet. As petrol and diesel prices are sky rocketing day by day, the choice of buying EV instead of diesel car is looking a better option.

In February Center announced plan to launch National Hydrogen Energy Mission. Two hydrogen refueling stations have been established (one each at Indian Oil R&D Centre, Faridabad and National Institute of Solar Energy, Gurugram) as per data received from MNRE website. Policy is very soon to pave the path for Green Hydrogen Economy.
title: Hydrogen as a fuel, Policy very soon says government sources
Buy Green Number plate with no registration certificate fees
description: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways on Tuesday said it has issued a notification to exempt battery-operated (BV) vehicles from the payment of fees for issue or renewal of registration certificate. In a statement, the ministry said it has also exempted battery-operated vehicles from the payment of fees for the assignment of new registration marks. This has been notified to encourage e-mobility, it added.

title: Ola starts Electric Scooter Booking for just 499/-
description: As per the Ola Electric CEO, the Ola Scooter will be launched on 15th August 2021 in a dedicated event. Ola will set up more than 1 Lakh charging points across 400 cities in India. These charging stations will be able to charge the Ola Electric bike for 75 KMS in 10 minutes of charging. Ola Electric Scooter’s colours options have emerged online. The official tweet from Ola Electric’s CEO shows there will be black, red, pink, light blue, green, yellow, white, etc 10 colour variants of this electric bike from Ola. Ola Electric Bike’s Top Speed details have also been leaked. Data has been provided at the end of this page. Customers with the Pre-booking will get an option to select the Ola scooter’s colour option before scheduling the delivery. Ola Electric Scooter price may start from ₹85,000 if recent media reports are to believed. The company is targeting 50% or more of the total two-wheelers market.

We are moving towards Hydrogen Economy where Heavy transportation, Industries, Ships , planes and passenger vehicles use Green hydrogen as a fuel. It is the most abandon source of energy available today. Corporates and companies around the world investing billions of dollars new investment to be in the race.
title: Green Hydrogen- Trillion Dollar opportunity
Aluminum Vs Lithium-ion battery- Case to case
description: Developer claim Aluminum –Ion battery charges 60 times faster than Lithium Ion and hold three times more energy over lithium ion. They are safer with no spontaneous overheating, more cost sustainable because of material availability and easier to recycle.  Lithium Ion batteries are most commonly used in Electrical gadgets and vehicle across the globe because of its cost advantage. One of the major issue in Li-On is capacity degradation, safety concern and aging.

title: 1GW Renewable Energy addition every month for next 5 year- Bridge to India
description: India is expected to add on average 1 GW of Renewable Energy every month, total 68 gigawatt (GW) of renewable capacity in five years, up marginally from previous year’s estimate of 60 GW, with solar occupying 65 per cent of the share, according to a recent survey.  Gujarat, Maharashtra, and Karnataka emerged as the top three states for overall growth prospects of renewable power projects in the survey.

Tamil Nadu: Tamil Nadu Government has notified 100 per cent motor vehicle tax exemption for battery-operated vehicles (Electric Vehicles).  the state offers various incentives including 100 per cent GST reimbursement, 50 per cent capital subsidy among others to attract investments.         Maharashtra: While there’s a basic subsidy of Rs 5,000 per kwh of the battery on all kinds of EVs, the maximum incentive cap differs for two and three-wheelers – capped at Rs 10,000 and Rs 30,000 respectively – and four-wheelers (capped at Rs 1.5 lakh). Gujarat: The Gujarat Electric Vehicle Policy 2021 provides for subsidy of up to Rs 20,000 on EVs in the two-wheeler category, Rs 50,000 for three-wheelers, and up to Rs 1.5 lakh for cars. Also, the State government has exempted e-vehicles registered in Gujarat RTOs from paying registration fee.
title: Subsidy on Electrical Vehicle- Gujarat, Maharashtra, Rajasthan leads
Generation E: An All Electric is the future.
description: If you don’t want to like, still you like. Change is evident to resist.  The Start Button to an All-Electric Future has Been Pushed. Which means the day will soon come when everybody can drive an EV. The E- revolution has begun. More than 100 New Model, Billions of new investment committed, GW hours of cell batteries plants and there is only one goal Net zero= Zero emission= All Electric.

title: Electric vehicles are driving change
description: Electrical vehicles takes over sooner than we think. The change is visible in people's mindset. According to JP Morgan, by the year 2025, most electric vehicles and hybrid electric vehicles will account for almost 30 % of cars on sale. This not only monopolizes the electric car industry but also enables for more innovation and advancements surrounding sustainable transportation. Consumer are willing to pay premium to buy next EV in replace of diesel car.

The Dream is to become Net Zero and Green Hydrogen has the serious potential and abundant resources to achieve the target. Energy security and decarbonizing many processes in cement, Chemical, Steel, Fertilizer industries to ensure faster adoption. But current high prices and safety concern in transportation and utilization need to solve in short term.
title: Green Hydrogen – Dream Vs Reality

description: India has revised its proposed $8 billion scheme for the auto sector which will now focus on incentivizing companies to build electric and hydrogen fuel-powered vehicles. This is a significant shift from the government’s original plan to incentivize auto and auto part makers to build mainly gasoline vehicles and their components for domestic sale and export, with some added benefit for EV. Government is focused on adopting clean mobility so it can reduce its oil dependences and cut pollution, while also meeting its commitment under the Paris climate goal.
title: $ 8 Billion Booster dose for EV & Hydrogen by Government

description: Reliance is moving towards manufacturing batteries for Renewable energy storage. Success stories from Germany, Australia, and the United States show the way for India to integrate large-scale variable renewable into its power grid.
title: Reliance found new Gem in Battery Storage

description: Producing Hydrogen by uses of Renewable Energy sources as electricity is coded as a Green Hydrogen. India is betting on Electrical vehicles and Hydrogen for net zero. To run electrical vehicles we require raw material import of lithium-ion batteries that again make no sense in contrast to curb on diesel import. Also lithium-ion resources are limited compare to abundant availability of hydrogen. India has ample resources of renewable sources like solar and wind that require to product Green hydrogen. India has everything to become self reliant Hydrogen economy in interest of nation’s energy security.
title: “Green Hydrogen” a serious candidate for India’s energy security.

description: Reliance Industries has announced plan to invest of USD $10 Billion on clean Energy and set a target of achieving 100GW RE energy by 2030. To achieve this ambitious target, Reliance is setting up GIGA factory at their Jamnagar facility to produce indigenously solar cell, wafer and solar panel.
title: Reliance found new gold mine in Solar

type: China Crack down on private companies, calling India opportunity
description: Trillions of dollars wiped out from market after china crack down private companies trigger fears of future innovation in the world’s second largest economy. Its Beijing’s plan or to regain more harsh control over private companies, India is tapping opportunity in these. Investor in tech and new energy eyes more and more fund inflow in to the Indian market.  As market climbs new high, unrest in neighboring economy always sign a positive move for India.
title: China Crack down on private companies, calling India opportunity
EV Startup ready for disruption in two wheeler Market
type: EV Startup ready for disruption in two wheeler Market
description: Slowly and steadily, stage is set for EV inroads in India. Indian two wheeler market mainly dominated by Hero MotoCorp, Bajaj, Honda, Yamaha and TVS are facing heat from new entrants in EV segment like, Ola Electric, Euler Moters, Blive, Ather Energy, Revolt and many more.  Some of these startups are deeply funded and attracted best talent. They have managed to get customer traction and created niche brand image by moving faster than big rivals. Obviously disruption is imminent and feel is visible on floor. The M&A and consolidation is not expected in near terms, let see who survive in EV race.

title: Domino starts Green Delivery of Pizza
type: Domino starts Green Delivery of Pizza
description: Next time when you order pizza from Domino’s, you may get your pizza deliver on Electrical Vehicle. Domino’s has join hand with Revolt motors to convert existing petrol bikes to Electrical Vehicles. In an exclusive partnership with Domino’s, Revolt motors deliver customizes Electrical Vehicles for their delivery operation.

The future of mobility is shifting to environmental-friendly, connected, autonomous, and personalized commute.  India is successfully leading trend in future of mobility. Under Aatmanirbhar Bharat policy India is moving towards net zero, banking on Renewable Energy sources and zero emission vehicles. By 2030 India’s energy import bill could reduce by 25% to $90 billion and 50% by 2040 to $50 billion and 75% By 2050 to $25 billion. That means more and more opportunity rise in energy generation by Solar and wind, storage of RE energy in GIGA scale batteries, replacing gasoline power cars with Electrical vehicles and deep decarbonizing or transporting with green hydrogen. Be ready to work on $200 Billion opportunity.
type: Next Business opportunity in EV, Storage & Green Hydrogen
title: Next Business opportunity in EV, Storage & Green Hydrogen
Highways to have solar panels
description: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Energy Efficiency Services (EESL), a joint venture (JV) of PSU of Ministry of Power, to conduct feasibility studies of establishment of solar power projects on the available vacant land parcels with NHAI and rooftops of NHAI buildings/structures at toll plazas and other NHAI-owned buildings/structures. So far, no proposal has been received by NHAI.

title: India Not China- New Normal for unicorn Startup
description: China was a longtime favorite of unicorn hunters, but Covid-19, Chinese regulatory actions against its own tech giants and the sudden loss of civil rights in Hong Kong have given investors pause. So they are crowding into India, which is home to 58 unicorns today. For comparison, the United Kingdom has just 20. One of the leaders of the pack is Tiger Global, a New York-based investment firm that is pouring billions of new dollars into the Indian startup ecosystem.
type: India Not China- New Normal for unicorn Startup
Round the Clock(RTC) Renewable energy to power Home: Renew Power
title: Round the Clock(RTC) Renewable energy to power Home: Renew Power
description: “ReNew had won the bid to supply Round-The-Clock power in 2020 through an auction conducted by SECI. As per the contract, ReNew Power will supply electricity in the first year at ₹2.90/kWh (about 3.9 cents). This tariff will increase by 3% annually for the first 15 years, after which it will stabilize for the remaining 10 years of the 25-year contract.

India import average 225 Million tons of crude and 200 MT of Coal and coke resulting $200 billion of import every year. with available abundance resource in RE like Solar & Wind, EV, Storage and Green hydrogen all together save over $200 billion worth of imports for India — $112 billion on crude, $9.6 billion on natural gas/LNG, $23.6 billion on coal, $16.2 billion on petroleum products and $775 million on ammonia. Indian conglomerates like Reliance, TATA, Adani, Jindal are in race to add more than 200GW of RE energy by 2030.
title: Clocking $200 Billion opportunity in Energy segment

description: Latest in Gujarat, GUVNL withdraws subsidies on much hyped Small Scale Solar power Project abruptly, affecting 4000 such applicant and 2500 MW solar power projects put on hold. Although project subsidies on investment by MSME industries announced much earlier in Gujarat industrial policy 2020, sudden decision stranded solar projects worth 10000 Cr and dent investment sentiment. Subsidies across the RE projects are falling, Industry body cautions that unsubsidized solar projects planned by private businesses will simply not be built.
type: No Subsidy for SSDSP – Say GUVNL
title: No Subsidy for SSDSP – Say GUVNL
GIGA numbers behind Reliance GIGA Factory
description: India is working on target of installing 175GW of Renewable Energy by 2022 and 450GW of green energy by 2030 where 40% of that nearly 180GW to come from Solar. Coming $100 Billion Green Hydrogen and Green ammonia opportunity could explode the growth of solar power. Keeping eye on electricity amendment bill to tap next $100 Billion opportunity in energy generation and distribution, where TATA & Ambani already lead the race, Reliance is setting up GIGA factories to manufacture indigenous Hydrogen Fuel Cell, Solar panel and Hi power batteries at Jamnagar.
type: GIGA numbers behind Reliance GIGA Factory

description: Yes, you have heard right. IOC is building India's first green hydrogen plant at its Mathura refinery.  World is moving towards net zero emission and oil companies are switching to green power by decarbonizing some of their process. Extracting Hydrogen via renewable sources called green hydrogen.  Days are very near where we see hydrogen power buses on road in Delhi & Gujarat. EV charging, E-mobility, Battery storage, Green Hydrogen are the mix of technology to concentrate in near future.
type: Who is building India's first green hydrogen plant “IOC”
title: Who is building India's first green hydrogen plant  “IOC”

type: Solar Panel Prices to remain high until Q4 2022
title: Solar Panel Prices to remain high until Q4 2022
description: Leading chinese manufactures have said that increasing price of raw material lead to sharp increase of solar panel price and there is no respite until Q4 2022. Tight supply of the solar panel raw material is expected to persist this year that drive further price rises. Shortage of polysilicon and all time high ocean freight lead to per Wp solar price in northern direction. Prices may sustain at current level or may increase further.                                                                                        More over Government going to impose 40% BCD from 1st April 2022, now the impact of that is yet to asses in long term. Industry body cautions that unsubsidized solar parks planned by private businesses will simply not be built. Many industry expert anticipated that growth of solar industry could explode if Green hydrogen and green ammonia facilities to come online by that time.

Energy 4.0 as it is called, will enable the industry to implement intelligent energy and power management solutions based on machine to machine and machine to human interactions.	                                                                            1.	Rooftop Solar: India to add 40GW of rooftop solar by 2030.                                                                                      2. Electrical Vehicle: Increasing fuel prices and attractive policy, it is a game changer in personal vehicle segment by 2025.                                                                                                        3. Storage: Smart and intelligent devices that store excess RE power in peak time and re-utilize at night saving grid connectivity.                                                                                                                   4. Hydrogen Mobility/Transportation: A new candidate in RE segment that makes net zero emission a reality.
title: 4 Energy Trends to know

description: Kutch is poised to become world’s largest Green hydrogen Hub. The region is known for barren land and white desert, is now attracting investment of more than 2 lakh Cr.  The 30000 MW Hybrid Renewable Energy Park and upcoming 4.75GW RE Park of NTPC REL, will produce Giga Watt Electricity and green hydrogen to power India's future energy needs.                                                                                                                                                                                     Region is also become one of the Integrated Green Energy Hub propose by National hydrogen Energy Mission (NHM) because of its strategic advantage of land mass availability, higher solar radiation and port connectivity for export market.
title: “Kutch” - India’s  Green Hydrogen hub
